p: The bacterial gene copy, metabolite concentration (lactate, SCFAs, ammonia, amines, and phenol and indole compounds), and gene expression data that were normally distributed were analyzed by One-way ANOVA with a Tukey’s post hoc test. Data are expressed as means ± standard error of mean (SEM), and P ≤ 0.05 was regarded as significant. Correlations between mucosal gene expression and significantly changed bacterial abundances (at the genus level and qPCR, q < 0.05) and fermentation end-products by dietary treatment were analyzed by Spearman’s correlation analysis using GraphPad Prim version 5.0 (GraphPad Software, San Diego, CA, USA). A correlation was considered significant when the absolute Spearman’s correlation coefficient was > 0.5 and significant at P < 0.05.
